content:
Posted: April 5, 2014
												"Piece of art"Goat Simulator is the new and promising game by Swedish game developer Coffee Stain Studios.In the game you get to play as a goat and all you have to do is to wreck things and hurt people.Many people think that Goat Simulator is "funny" or even "stupid", but what they don't understand is the fact, that the game is criticism of our modern society in asophisticated way: The people behind Coffee Stain Studios want to say that a goat simply could not fit into our society, it would just destroy everything without knowingwhat it does. You get the feeling that you cannot be a normal human being. You are being reminded by this depressing fact in every possible way:  - You see robots - When you want to attend a family dinner, you cannot do anything but destroy it. - When playing the popular video game "Flappy Bird" you, and only you, are a goat in the game.Other people in the city will not react to your cries for help, they will only run away from you. You are searching for attention but everyone will ignore you.Another sad fact is that you will encounter one scene in the game where people actually pay attention to you, but they just want to see you fight against other goats.The atmosphere of the game is very depressing. Seeing how the town is slowly being destroyed by protesters, that don't want "♥♥♥♥♥♥♥shaped food" nearly made me shed a tear.This criticism makes the game something speacial, I would even say it will get the "GO(A)TY 2014" award.Coffee Stain studios have done a really good job by implementing a workshop feature, that allows players to create other maps, goats and other things.=> I highly recommend this game because of its' unique experience. However it is quite expensive and not really worth 10€.5€ would be more matching with the cost-benefit ratio.

content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												As an avid Goat enthusiast/fetishist, I bought 'Goat "Simulator"' during the recent steam sale, and I must reluctantly say, it was not worth the purchase. The game prides itself on being a 'Simulator', yet the realistic experience of playing a goat that was advertised is not delivered upon. For example- 1) Goat's tounges are NOT adhesive, and they do not have the strength to pull along cars or people, as this game suggests. 2) There is no Goat devil or angel - goats do not have a religion. 3) The goat in this game can survive falls from extreme heights, explosions, being hit by cars, and being sucked into fans. Goats in real life are NOT immortal. 4) Goats cannot perform front OR backflips, nor can they 'manual' on their front paws. 5) In reality, Goats are NOT able to ride on Bikes or skateboards. Goats have a poor sense of balance, due to a natural inner-ear problem evident in their species  - this is perhaps the one thing this game portrays accurately. Overall, this game was extremely dissapointing. I expected another game for me to spend hours in, simulating my dream of being a goat and mating with female goats, or milking myself, yet in the end I found this game lacking of everything that I expected.

number of helpful: 17 of 30 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2014
												This game sucks.Yes yes, it's an april fools joke, I understand, I have some humour. But ten euros for this disaster is just overpriced and it's one of the top selling games already for a week just because youtubers play it.So, there are multiple factors that make this game an abomination.The bugs, this game is one of the buggiest games I've ever seen, when you start to play it it is so funny HAHA THAT GOAT DOES FUNNY HAHA, but after a half hour all the jokes in this game become very repetitive and plain annoying. You can't walk without tripping over anything and then you have to wait until your goat stands up again, and three seconds later he's on the ground again. Also, when you're trying to do something it happens sometimes that you fly all over to the other side of the map because of a random programmed bug. And other situations are that you're trying to get on a roof for a trophy for the achievements, but you keep falling through the roof and then you have to climb up all your way back. And don't get me started on the bug that some 3d models like cars or trampolines don't appear until you're close to them.The controls, the controls are so annoying, your goat goes most of the time for no reason in "muscles off" mode, and sometimes it takes time to undo that, guess why, because the controls aren't responding. The game is set for a QWERTY keyboard, mine is AZERTY, in almost all games you can edit the controls, and in all of those they stay saved, but of course, in this one, the controls don't save, you have to redo the controls all the time again and again and it gets annoying quick, and because that you get stuck a lot, you have to reset the game again and again and that obviously correlates with resetting the controls. There are also some control bugs, like when you start a new game the controls are not responding, etc.... And the worst thing is the acceleration of your goat. Since you fall so much, you have to accelerate again, and it goes from very slow to fast that you can't control your goat, and when you stop your goat while running he might fall over.The achievements, most are very easy to get, it's fun getting a lot of achievements quick and seeing funny things, but then there are the unfair ones. And I mean unfair, not challenging. For example, the achievements of Payday 2 are insanely hard, but fair, the achievements of Angry Video Game Nerd adventures are hard, it's a hard platformer, but still, fair. But the achievements are this just♥♥♥♥♥♥you off so much. Let's take the all trophies one, some trophies are very easy to get, but others are on impossible locations with such big bugs that they're impossible to get that it takes you so many tries. Like the one under the fan, there is a spinning fan on a hard to reach location, and behind that fan theres a trophy, and the fan spins fast, and if you touch it you get rocketed to the other side of the map, that means you have to walk so much and fall over a lot again, reach that hard to reach location, and then try again. And since the controls are so annoying it's almost impossible to go over the fan, it took me so long and it was so annoying, but that's only one of the multiple hard to reach and unfair trophies. The jump on the five trampolines in one jump trophy is so annoying too because you can't see the trampolines until you are close to them because of bugs. So you have to search all the map for trampolines and perfectly remember their placement and then jump the very buggy jump controls which takes ages. And then there's the worst... the horrible... flappy goat achievement.... It's like flappy bird, but on a very small screen, full of bugs and much faster. So you go in a building and there's a tv there and on it flappy goat. The screen of that tv is small so you have to look very good, and it goes fast and you flap high. Also, the worst about it is the horrible collision, your goat touches the pipes even when it's not touching it, you really have to be far away from the pipes to not touch them, this took me a hour of pure frustration to do.Well, that's about it, this game is overrated, a disaster, overpriced and annoying. 1/10 just because it made me laugh in the first half hour

content:
Posted: April 16, 2014
												Have you always dreamed of being a goat? Well luckily for you some people do as well, hence, Goat Simulator. You play as a goat with a messed up neck and oversized tongue with the tendency to hump the floor rather than walk. You headbutt strangers into Michael Bay sized explosions because sure... why not? This game does have some minor "quests" if you can call it that, rather it seems like it tosses you some cookies to still be interested in the cookie jar. There isn't much to "do" if you're a I NEED OBJECTIVES kind of a game player, but if you're looking to troll around town with a horribly flawed physics engine and stick your tongue in very rude places then perhaps this game is for you. If not for the goat, buy it for the music. It makes the atmosphere that much derpier. Overall, the price is a bit steep for a goat sand box, but it isn't something I regret buying. Also if you dream of being a back flipping gymnist, then this simulator is for you. Girls got nothing on my goat flippin' skillz.  6/10

content:
Posted: March 29, 2014
												It's not just a simulation, it's a journey. Through this groundbreaking simulation we are transformed; able to repercieve and refine our own lives through the experience of partaking of the essence of another lifeform. Some may see only a goat, but we become more. We surpass the mundane. We become the goat elivened with dreams, fantasies, and aspirations. Through the goat we become free to live out any and all freedoms this sumulated life grants us, free from disarming and constricting social bonds. As I partake of the simulation, I find myself overcome by the enlightenment granted by multiple and sometimes conflicting perceptions of the self. I am reminded that consciousness as we know it is infused throughout reality. I am redeemed. I am reborn. A solid 7/10.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												I've been a big fan of simulators for a long time now, and I look especially for depth, immersion and authenticity in all aspects of a good simulator game. ArmA has always been one for me that has brought me deep into the world of something I enjoy and given me a true to life, realistic perspective of what it would be like to live a day in those shoes. Goat Simulator however, takes it to a whole new level.I've watched goats for a long time now, studied them profusely and would in fact go as far as to call myself a Connoisseur of Goats, and what really impressed me about Goat Simulator is the sheer depth that it has achieved in making a goats daily life something that we can all enjoy. Whether you are simply exploring or as goats are prone to do, dragging a car up a water slide with your sticky tongue, you really feel like you're in the shoes of the Goat, or in its hooves should I say, and when you look at the physical properties the game accurately portrays of a goat in free fall or its impacting upon the ground, you really get a feel for just how passionately the R&D team on Goat Simulator studied the physical attributes of goats and their effects on the world for the games portrayle.I must say that as both an officionado of Goats and Simulators I couldn't ask for much more, however I am looking forward to a version that is compatible with Occulus Rift, so that I may see the world through a goats eyes. A tip to anybody who is seeking a more authentic, goatier expiriences, play the game with cups over your hands to simulate goat hooves, you will not be dissapointed, I promise you.10/10 - Redefines Perfection

content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												This simulator is unquestionably the pinnacle of video gaming; in fact, it is the pinnacle of all human endeavor. That's right, folks - architecture, literature, drama, science - nothing compares, and nothing else ever will compare (not even the mythical Candy Crush Super Deluxe Xtreme Edition). It's all down hill from here.At least we can be comforted by the existence of Goat Simulator as we begin the long, slow, inexorable slide into the void. When the heat death of the universe comes, the last sentient creatures in the galaxy will know that all of this, all of everything that has ever taken place, was worth it... because of Goat Simulator.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												Goat Simulator is a joke of a game. It’s small, deliberately unpolished and buggy, and its design is simple. So it’s a good thing it’s a really funny joke, full of great physics-powered slapstick humor, and unexpected surprises in every corner of its seemingly peaceful small-town map. There’s not much actual gameplay here beyond breaking things for points, but shooting for a high score is probably the least entertaining thing about Goat Simulator. It’s mostly about exploring the fun house and discovering the hilarious surprises at your own pace.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												For years my goat enthusiast friends and I have been searching for a game that fully takes advantage of the many paradigms that goats have to offer. Coffee Stain Studios had a chance to capture a niche market looking for the ultimate in goat simulation software. I had considered investing thousands in computer peripherals to enhance my simulation experience, including buying a 640 by 480 monitor to better simulate goat vision, goat food trays for my desk as well as a conversion of my gaming room into a barn.  There was a palpable desire for this game amongst us in the goat enthusiast community for many years, and this game promised to deliver with realistic physics and visuals. For the past few months since I have heard about this game, I have begun eating nothing but dried grass and water and sat next to my calendar and my computer waiting for the game to be released. This game consumed me that the only thing I could say was “I love goats” in a vacant voice. I have not moved for 3 weeks now, my room smells horrible. My wife and kids have left me, but I’m not really sure because they didn’t matter now that Goat Simulator was on the horizon. Soon I could be the goat. Soon I would be ready to receive. My body most definitely was ready.However, much to my dismay, Coffee Stain Studios merely mocked us in the goat enthusiast community. This game was an utter disappointment. I want my goat simulators designed by goat experts, who have had years in the field. Clearly these people have never met goats. I have been a connoisseur in goats for over 30 years, and this game is nothing more than contrived misinformation by governments worldwide against the goat cause. There seems to be a vendetta against goats in this society, these ‘goatists’ such as the ones at Coffee Stain Studios have  insulted the entire goat race and they should apologise. I demand a refund. This goat persecution should not be tolerated. I have reached out to many news agencies to hear my plight, and I am hoping Anita Sarkeesian will address this issue in the next goatist frequency video.Pros:-	The New Lick Feature is much appreciated – it brought many things to the gameplay I did not expect possible with our current technology. I was able to realistically simulate goat.Cons:-	I was hoping for a 24/7 live updated, real time world with weather affects and PhysX GoatTM, with live feed satellite rendering of the earth’s surface so I could realistically move my goats between all the world’s major goat farming areas and enter my goat into beauty contests.-	The sacrifice area and devil goat were unnecessary. However, if you enjoyed scarier elements of games like Farming Simulator and Chemical Spillage Simulator, this would be right up your alley9/10 would play again.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												   So, you are looking at buying Goat Simulator as I was only a few days ago. You are probably also thinking, "What has my life come down to that I am actually going to purchase and spend time on a game that lets me become a goat?" This is my story.   I awoke in a field. My body feeling odd and warm as if I had just fallen asleep under the sun for a few hours. Before moving, I realized that I was much closer to the ground than I had been prior to this sleep. I looked around, and suddenly realized that my vision was thrown off a bit, Like I had a wider field of view, as if I were now able to see things like wolves and suchat greater angles of vision. I used this ability to peer at my own body, which I had just realized was covered in nappy gray fur. I got up, realizing that  I am now a goat.   Well ♥♥♥♥.I walked over to the fence that had now filled my entire view, as I am now a goat which is around four feet tall. I tried to climb over it, when suddenly, every part of my body fell limp. I could not move. Slumped halfway over a fence, and I could not move a muscle. Any body who walked by probably thought that I was a "special goat".   All of the sudden, a thought popped into my head for a split second. Press Q ♥♥♥♥♥♥....]   And I stood up. I made it over the fence and found myself in a town I had never seen before. It was small, some citizens were walking down the streets, cars bustling down those same ones. I tried getting help, running up to the nearest man who looked to be in his mid 40's.   "BYAAAHHHHHWWWWWW" I screamed at him, trying to say help.   "Oh my god it's going to kill me!" The man started to run.   I chased after him, "Byaaaaahhhh.....BBAaaaaaahhhhh....YYUUUEEEAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH"   He just kept running. I had found myself near a gas station and decided to run inside. The shopkeeper was quick to shoe me out, but in the process, I may have destroyed every piece of merchandise in the store. As I ran out, I slpped on the sidewalk and fell back into the state of "slumped limbs" or what some mght call "Ragdoll mode". My body flew acrosss the ground like marbles of a gameboard and slammed into a Honda civic, causing the car to explode. Yes, explode. This is not where it ends though as the explosion of the car triggered the gas tanks underground to explode as well. Sending my body into a suborbital trajectory. Yes, still alive even after two explosions and running out of air. I was intercepted by an astronaught named Jeb, as I flew, he brought his ship alongside my slow-floating body and brought me aboard.    We landed safely in the ocean and are now awaiting recovery.   -Submitted From KerPhone 510/10 Would Review Again.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												This simulator is unquestionably the pinnacle of video gaming; in fact, it is the pinnacle of all human endeavor. That's right, folks - architecture, literature, drama, science - nothing compares, and nothing else ever will compare (not even the mythical Candy Crush Super Deluxe Xtreme Edition). It's all down hill from here.At least we can be comforted by the existence of Goat Simulator as we begin the long, slow, inexorable slide into the void. When the heat death of the universe comes, the last sentient creatures in the galaxy will know that all of this, all of everything that has ever taken place, was worth it... because of Goat Simulator.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												"Happiness isn't happiness without a violin playing goat."     - Julia RobertsHere we 'Goat' again with another simulator hitting the Steam front page. But wait, Goat Simulator is not like any other simulator that has preceded it. It's actually not that 'BAAAAD'. I mean, this is how goats are actually like in real life. Everyone knows that goats and trampolines together creates mass genocide, it's just common sense. I'll be honest, this isn't really the type of amazing piece of work you might expect from 'Van goat.' Nonetheless, Goat Simulator is one of those games where all its imperfections are what make it priceless. You might be stroking your 'goatee' in wonder, or perhaps really not at all, but rest assured that bugs and game-breaking hilarity are intentional mechanisms of the game's entertainment philosophy. It's hard to really write a review with so many goat puns 'butting' in, so I think you'll just have to take my word on the fact that this game is amazing.So don't be such a 'kid' and just get this game. You really won't regret the 'charge' on your card, despite any 'ramifications' created from the time you will waste playing this game. Or dont, whatever floats your 'Goat.'

Posted: July 27, 2014
												This game...  this game right here changed me from doesn't even care about goats into I LOVE goats and wish that they could actually do all of the chaos that this game has. There is a LOT of things to do in this game. I mean, you get to sacrifice humans what gets better than that?!  You get to headbutt people, do frontflips, fall off of buildings and survive, lick things and carry whatever you licked with you, lots of hidden objectives to do, turn into different types of goat, and etc etc.In conclusion, most hilarious game I've ever played. I have no idea how many drugs they were on before they created it, but it is on my top ten game list. If you havn't heard or played this game I'm very disapointed in you. It is definatly worth the money and is a must play game.BUY IT AND PLAY IT!!!!!

content:
Posted: April 7, 2014
												I pledge allegiance to the goat Of the United States of GoatmericaAnd to the Baaa-public for which it stands One nation under goats, IndivisibleWith liberty and justice for goats Okay, that's enough jokes involving goats and 'Murica. This game is esentially a physics-based Three Stooges game, only this time Moe, Larry, and Curly are gone and in their place is a humble goat that defies the laws of physics and gets into absurdist slapstick mayhem complete with oddball gags and easter eggs. It's dumb, crazy fun for those that want a good set of laughs.

I had also heard several negative coments about the game for being to glitchy and slow. But thhese are just coming from the non-goaters (otherwise known as the sheep). They have no taste in good games and are afraid to experience the sensations of being a goat. Don't be a sheep, get this game.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
												Dragged 5 people into a pentagram and sacrificed them to become evil.  Then used my newfound evil powers to fly around the in no particular direction, only stopping when I collided with a half constructed building.  For some inexplicable reason, said building had a jetpack lying around, to which I used hoping it would provide me with a more controlled flight.  What I got was a flight that sent me on a one way ticket underneath the map that could only be fixed with the "Restartlevel" console command.  10/10 would buy again!

content:
Posted: April 4, 2014
												An honest review here...The game itself is riddled with bugs, funny moments, crazy physics and cool easter eggs. At first glance and reading PC Mag's review of this game, I was going in with the attitude of '20 minutes of fun for ten bucks'. I could never have been more wrong. After doing achievments and easter egg hunting for about an hour and a half, I checked out the steam workshop and started playing GOAT PINBALL. I downloaded some custom models for my goat and turned into shrek, my hero. I felt a warm glow behind my desk.I turned, a green ogre greeted me with a toothy grin."YA LIKE ME GAME, LADDEH?" He bellowed with glee. I lay down and knew what was coming. He stuffed himself inside of my ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and it hurt. But I did it for shrek. He let out one mighty roar as he filled my butt with onion-flavoured ogre love. Then I realised it was the next week and I decided to stop playing Goat Simulator.10/10 Shrek is Love, Shrek is life.

												In the first few moments of being a goat I thought I was a simple creature not capable of destruction or harm. But I soon came to realize that I was quite the opposite....I was next to a cliff and at the bottom of the cliff was a lake, so following my newly discovered  destructive goat instincts I grabbed a woman by her ankle with my tongue and then ran full speed towards the cliff. Upon my descent I slowed down time and saw an entirely new world.... I could see the terror on the womans face as we fell to the water below... And it brought me great joy.That was only the beginning of my reign of terror, and what followed has still only scratched the surface of my potential.11.5/10

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												The concept of Goat Simulator is funny.  However the few levels it has are very small and it gets boring EXTREMELY fast.  This is caused by the only real goal in the game, to "get more points" or attempt to do a different stunt.  After hitting people or doing stuff to cars there is no consequences or reactions, they just reset and continue what they were doing.  The glitches are funny, but they are too common so it gets old fast.  You may be able to have more fun playing it with a friend, but I still don't think it will be long before you both move on to a different game.  What would make the game better is if you start destroying stuff, and then the people "around you" (not everyone) start running after you.  A consequence.  The more you people you disturb, the more people run after you.  And if you are caught, you are sent to animal control or something where the level ends.  Which can end up in true chaos and panic as you try to get away and keep your points or try to still increase them.  But instead, the people just get up, the items just reset and everything continues on its robotic paths. No chaos, no consequence, no end, no truly fun goal.If a friend bought it already, play their copy, but I don't recommend buying it yourself.If you bought this hoping for a lot of fun or constant laughs, but disappointed like I was, I'm truly sorry.  Perhaps the developer will read this and add in the feature that I mentioned, "without additional glitches".

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												Goat Simulator is incredibly boring, despite what twitch streamers/youtubers fooled you into thinking of it as simple entertainment. To put it simply, it's a poorly featured game overhyped by the internet. Without DLC, there's a very limited assortment of things that you can actually do. What this game expects you to do is pay a few bucks for a part of the game that makes it playable, and then immediately asks you to go get their DLC to play more than just a measly few maps. This shouldn't be the case for a game that already has so little to do other than charge into people and stand on top of vehicles. Even when I got this for a discount price, I still found it ultimately wasteful of both time and money. The only way this game is ever "fun" is when you see someone else killing off their wallet for Twitch viewers. Otherwise, it isn't a fun game, and you should not be fooled by the popularity of the concept since it gets boring really quick. (Hell, if you want to be specific, only one person in my whole friends list played this piece of crap for more than five hours.)I'm never buying into the simulator fad again.

												I've looked through the positive reviews and a lot of them seem to be jokes, so I figured I would finally try my hand at a real one. This game is incredibly fun. I picked it up pretty early on, when you had to buy a key from the dev. It's silly as hell, and that's the main part of it. You're a goat. You destroy things. There are glitches which are mostly humorous. The game is completely absurd and doesn't try to be anything else.The game will give you various tasks to do such as getting a certain combo, getting hit by a car, earning X number of points, etc. Therein lies the "plot" so to speak. As of now there are two maps, but there are "exits" to go from one map to the next which, given the current environment, suggests there will be a third map at some point. Both maps are fairly large. There is plenty to find/ explore on each map, which should keep you busy for a while.There are a few drawbacks to the game, however. Occasionally the glitches can be bad enough to ruin the session. Entirely possible it's my set up, but worth mentioning all the same. The other drawback is that replay value is somewhat limited. If you spend a good two hours or so with a map, chances are you'll have seen/ completed most of what it has to offer. This was something that initially diminished my interest when I first bought the game, but that interest was completely renewed with the update that brought the second map. It's very much one of those games that you can get really into for short periods of time every now and again.Overall, the game is absolutely worth your time, even at full price. If you enjoy silly humor, destroying things, and the like, you will love this game. Despite the arguably limited replay value, it is a ton of fun. Each map has its own set of tasks (the list is identical between the two, I believe) and there are lots of secrets to find. The achievements add another level of fun as well, as some of them are fairly specific tasks. The only way you would not enjoy this game is if you have no sense of humor. You won't necessarily get hours and hours of fun/ playtime, but you'll get your money's worth ten times over.Edited for the steam award badge. Yay!

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												Sorry Coffee Stain, but I'm gonna have to say no to this game. Why? Well, granted, it's fun for maybe the first twenty minutes or so, but it gets inexplicably boring after a while. We've all seen ragdolling everywhere before, so watching a goat spazz out isn't exactly hilarious. I mean, if you want ragdolling, Garry's Mod is the place for that. Also, the map. For a map that's supposed to house a goat that could possibly get hit by a car and fly away, it's pretty tiny. Like, we're talking tiny tiny. Also, if you follow what the game tells you to do, after maybe an hour or so you'll end up with some serious lag. It's like, fresh at the start and dead at the end. There's no way you can reach that high point goal unless you're ♥♥♥♥in' a with combos. However, this game isn't all that bad. I mean, the Easter Eggs made me snort a little. Also, there's a Workshop mode, so you can play other maps and play as things other than a goat, such as the Heavy Weapons Guy.So, this game. 4/10.   Take the disclaimer seriously.Unless you can afford to throw around 10 bucks like it's♥♥♥♥♥♥ Then by all means, buy this game.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
												The thing about goat simulator is that its one of those games that is fun for a little bit and then you never play it again, you find the secrets and thats about it. It isn't really a game its just a simple sandbox that rather than having unlimited fun, it just kind of expires and you're left with nothing. I'd give cheers to the devs for getting new content out there, but the score system isn't enough to make it a game. No one bought goat simulator because they wanted to play it and get a high score, they bought it because they have nothing better to do and on account that the whole game is just a meme. Rather than making the whole game a joke being told over and over again, the developers should try to take an approach similar to Octodad, where the game had a STORY and there was a point of you being there, unlike Goat Simulator which doesn't really have an engaging goal or any story at all. Goat simulator's concept is alright, and it could work for sure, but the execution of it makes it bland and gives it a finite amount of entertainment. If the game was given a factor that made it feel a bit more like a game rather than just a limited sandbox then I might've given the game a positive rating. I realize I'm going to get hate for this practical look at this game based on my experience, and because when people read reviews they want everyone to have the exact same opinion. In conclusion, I rate Goat Simulator a 3/10, I think it just really needs a better pull factor than the score system and the "memes".

content:
Posted: August 2, 2015
												Here you are once more, on the Goat Simulator page on Steam. No... no, don't leave yet. Stay awhile -- relax a bit, have some tea. Chamomile perhaps? It was always a favorite of mine, back in the old days in the Romanian countryside, where I grew to manhood alongside Scruffles, my pet bear. Scruffles was a gentle bear for the most part, but he was a deeply troubled soul. I could not forsee what terrible things he would do to that family. Sometimes I think back on it and wonder what more I could have done for him; wonder if there were any signs that I missed, or if I had ever been unkind to him in any way...Oh, but I forget myself again. I apologize. Let me stoke the fire one moment.... there... now where were we? Oh yes, the game. Yes, here you are once more, perhaps after a few days, or maybe even months. You've heard whispers about it, you've seen the videos, and perhaps you even watched a friend play it. You saw it listed once, you clicked on it -- you debated on whether or not you should dip into the money you were saving for your wifes anniversary dinner. Or perhaps you scoffed, your nose held high, unwilling to part with your hard earned cash in exchange for this utter rubbish. Whatever the case, you're back here, aren't you?Is it a Steam sale that now draws your attention? Perhaps it's always been on your list of games to buy? Or has the morbid curiosity in you reached that point of no return? Are you unable to restrain yourself from clicking that purchase button? Are you even okay?Don't answer that last question; you ARE okay. You will be okay. Everything from now on will always be.... okay. You see it wasn't just you that brought you back here for what could possibly be the fifth time... it was Goat. You don't know Goat, except that you do. Goat has always been with you, whether you're aware of it or not. The lingering presence, the angel on your shoulder, the devil in your gut -- all of it was Goat. Goat has been with you in your dreams. Goat was with you during your SAT's. Goat was there when you stood beside the pastor and watched your beloved walk down the isle.Goat was there. Goat was always there.And here you are again, reading this review, wondering whether or not you should purchase Goat Simulator; wondering if it will fullfill you in ways only few other games have. Or maybe you just wonder why you're back here again, after so many other visits, trying to figure out just what it is that compells you to return. Well there are no more questions you need to ask yourself now is there? There are no more questions because suddenly the way is clear.Goat is calling you home. From the moment you were born, Goat has been there with you, watching over you, waiting until you were worthy of the glory that lies beyond the purchase button. Every time you nearly touched it, it was Goat that slapped your hand away.... because you were not yet ready for the greatness. But Goat is calling you, and you can hear him now. Goat is waiting for you on the other side. The great beyond lies waiting for you -- it is a place of light, healing, transcendance... and whales. Lots, and lots of whales.But above all the great beyond is that one place you've always been walking towards though you never really knew it. It's  Eden. It's Valhalla. It's the Stars. It's Goat Simulator.Come home to the great beyond. Come home to Goat.

Don't buy this game unless you have a high end computer.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												Worth every penny. (Well I bought it when it was on sale so.. if I bought it for $9.99 it wouldn't exactly be worth every penny.)ANYWAYS, I got this game over the weekend. In 10 hours I managed to complete 45/47 achievements of this game. This game is so beautiful. I'm going to faint. This made goats one of my favorite animals. 9.5/10Pros:-Beautiful world-Beautiful physics-Beautiful goat-SO many "easter eggs!" -Endless hillarious montage of fun-Touch a person and they flob as if they didn't have a spine-Combos are epic-All the different types of goats are epic-Workshops=endless fun-WHEE! FIREWORKS!-So many bugs. And yes, this is in the Pros list.-Really fun-to-do achievements.-100 more reasons this game is beautfully fit for any occasion.Cons:-You need a real good computer for this. Open world. Even at lowest settings you will get pretty low fps. How do I know this you ask? Well... um.. I just know? Eheh.-Some not-so-fun bugs, such as ones that will crash the game (but you get the achievement lolz) or ones where you get stuck under the floor so you have to respawn, but that's not a big matter because it's not like you can travel 100km in one map.-Kind of pointless game. BUT the achievements, which I worked on, kind of gives a point to this game.Overall one of the h4wtest games I've played.

												This game is hilarious and very fun...........for the first 30 minutes. It's glitchy fun at it's best, but the area is rather small and the objectives you have are very short and easy to complete. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												As a joke game this probably deserves a joke review, but it's actually a far more thoughtful and clever parody than the youtube fodder it presents as. The levels are basically just playgrounds filled with in-jokes and references for you to discover. Ranging from the obvious to those which take your brain a while to process and then you catch it and feel clever. If you're looking for a deeper purpose the achievements are a good way to discover what else there is in the levels, but there's no beginning and end point particularly so don't buy this if you're wanting a plot or progression system. Run around, find the jokes, hunt the achievements and have a good laugh. That's it, but sometimes that's actually all you need in a game. Side note: I nominated this for the 'best use of a farm animal' award, hence the review.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												Ah, Goat Simulator.  Try explaining this game to anyone that hasn't seen it and they will scoff at you for having spent 10 dollars on it.  It's beyond ridiculous, buggy as hell at times and there's even sort of a Goat Fight Club (shameless self promotion 


YouTube™ Video: GOAT SIMULATOR - Goat Fight Club!!! 

			Views: 50		

			GOAT SIMULATOR - First rule of Goat Fight Club...don't talk about B-A-A-A-A-A-H!!! More Goat Simulator game play. Let me know if you want to see some more.		

 ).That being said, if you enjoy ridiculous physics based games you will likely enjoy this one.  You play as a goat (among other things) and raise hell in a small town full of people straight out of a late 80's RUN D.M.C. video.  I was in tears laughing at how much of an @$$hole this goat was....then I realized, I'M THE @$$HOLE!  No real objective, but lots of hidden goodies to keep you playing for a little while.So in short, if being an @$$hole in real life isnt enough for you and you have always wanted to live vicariously through a goat...this game is for you!  Or if you just want to have a good laugh occasionally I recommend it.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												Worth every penny. (Well I bought it when it was on sale so.. if I bought it for $9.99 it wouldn't exactly be worth every penny.)ANYWAYS, I got this game over the weekend. In 10 hours I managed to complete 45/47 achievements of this game. This game is so beautiful. I'm going to faint. This made goats one of my favorite animals. 9.5/10Pros:-Beautiful world-Beautiful physics-Beautiful goat-SO many "easter eggs!" -Endless hillarious montage of fun-Touch a person and they flob as if they didn't have a spine-Combos are epic-All the different types of goats are epic-Workshops=endless fun-WHEE! FIREWORKS!-So many bugs. And yes, this is in the Pros list.-Really fun-to-do achievements.-100 more reasons this game is beautfully fit for any occasion.Cons:-You need a real good computer for this. Open world. Even at lowest settings you will get pretty low fps. How do I know this you ask? Well... um.. I just know? Eheh.-Some not-so-fun bugs, such as ones that will crash the game (but you get the achievement lolz) or ones where you get stuck under the floor so you have to respawn, but that's not a big matter because it's not like you can travel 100km in one map.-Kind of pointless game. BUT the achievements, which I worked on, kind of gives a point to this game.Overall one of the h4wtest games I've played.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												This game is hilarious and very fun...........for the first 30 minutes. It's glitchy fun at it's best, but the area is rather small and the objectives you have are very short and easy to complete. But the one thing that will keep you coming back to this game is the wacky stuff found on the workshop, and honestly, I think that's what saves it. That's why I give Goat Simulator a 7/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												As a joke game this probably deserves a joke review, but it's actually a far more thoughtful and clever parody than the youtube fodder it presents as. The levels are basically just playgrounds filled with in-jokes and references for you to discover. Ranging from the obvious to those which take your brain a while to process and then you catch it and feel clever. If you're looking for a deeper purpose the achievements are a good way to discover what else there is in the levels, but there's no beginning and end point particularly so don't buy this if you're wanting a plot or progression system. Run around, find the jokes, hunt the achievements and have a good laugh. That's it, but sometimes that's actually all you need in a game. Side note: I nominated this for the 'best use of a farm animal' award, hence the review.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												Well, you are a goat. You are nearly invincible... and a goat. You can become more than a goat, but you have the heart of a goat. This game is fantastic. I have never felt so in touch with my inner goat than with playing this game.  There are many, many bugs and glitches that might frustrate some, but if you are choosing to play this game, then you can choose to live with them. It is difficult to figure out everything you can do (I stumbled on how to flip until I READ THE LOADING SCREEN) but you can figure it out in time. There is no save per se, but you keep all your achievements so that helps.  I MUST recommend this game. It vents your frustation, quells your urge to kill your fellow man, reduces your desire to create bombs.. it fulfills your every desire, if that desire is to be an invincible goat. I love it. 10/10  no ifs ends or baa's about it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
												Why did I pick this one up?Well, the first (and main) reason is that I happen to like goats. They're cool. Goats are one of my favourite animals; they're certainly my favourite herbivorous mammal and just so happen to be my sign as well (Capricorn) so I've always considered them sort of my lucky animal-- in the same way as 34 is my lucky number. But that's neither here nor there.Aaaanyhow, about the actual game:It's a sandbox-style indie game, starring you as a very unrealistic goat. It should be fairly obvious by now that in no way is this an actual "goat simulator" that attempts to make you take on a realistic caprine role. It's very wacky and lighthearted and frivolous, and it's meant to be. And it even has a crazy story about a goat in purgatory, believe it or not. Check it out.As others have stated, Goat Simulator is fun in short bursts. I like sandbox games like this; such games give the player the freedom to run amok and do whatever your twisted little heart desires. The main goal is basically to cause as much destruction and mayhem as possible, and in the most creative ways possible. Try to cook up some wicked combos and you'll score high.If you dig sandboxy stuff, you'll probably enjoy this. If you like wrecking stuff and ramming innocent (and not-so-innocent) members of the homo sapiens species with your trusty set of horns, you'll definitely have a lot of fun with this game as well. It's not a game that's meant to be taken seriously, and I find it rather charming for what it is.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												Since the Dawn of Humanity itself, the question has always been present: What is it like to live and breathe as a goat ? THis game finally answers the age-old question. Goat Simultor, succesfully shows you the life through the eyes of a goat ( many different types of goats at that ), its stunning graphics along with extemely realistic in-game physics provides of you for an extremely authentic Goat Experience. THis is without a doubt the game of the decade, a true pioneer in the game world. This game is strongly worth every cent of its underpriced $9.99, I would gladly pay $5000, as such marvels in soceity must be funded. There is little chance a game will ever rival the stunning world of Goatville or Goatcitybay ( which rivals the size of the GTA V map). In summary, a true masterpiece that will be talked amongst forever, a game capable of making its viewers,: cry, laugh and appreciate and undestand the life of the Goat.

content:

												As someone that commented months ago on the tech demo that Coffee Stain Studios released for this to turn into a real game, I am very glad to see it actually made an released... This game, as the developers noted, is broken with crazy an silly bugs and extremely goofy in a small, yet very detailed world... Sacrificing humans, being king/queen goat, or being taken into space by a UFO are just some of the hilarious things that you can do in this game...Yes, the game is small as of right now... But even after 7 hours playing I am still finding ways to do crazy♥♥♥♥♥♥.. Plus the community workshop is slowly filling up with content so the fun will never stop with this game! This game was more than worth the $10 for admission... Get this game now and have a blast!

content:
Posted: March 28, 2014
												This game has more to it than it seems, it is in fact "greater than itself". There is a hidden story that is easily missed. This is what happenes to a goat that has been too evil to enter heaven and rejected to come to hell because of a deal Goat has made with the devil. The two tunnels on each side of the map symbolises the gate to heaven and hell. Even how hard you try, you cant go through them. You're rejected. One day Goat wants to be the king of all goats, and the only way to do it is to make a pact with the devil. In exchange with Goat's soul, the devil gave Goat the power of the Goat king. Then the day came to Goat as it does to all other creatures. The day they die. Since Goat sold his soul to the devil, he was meant to go to hell. Goat asked for a last meal, and he wanted the an apple in the tree, The Devil accepted his wish. While the devil climbed in the tree, Goat drew a holy cross on the trunk, rejecting the devil to come down. Goat told Satan that the only way he could get down from there was to give Goat his soul back. Satan had no choice and gave Goat his soul. Since Goat were still dead and now had his soul, he would ask God to come to heaven, but he was not allowed in. For all the sins he had commited he were not allowed to live in paradise. And since Satan do no longer wants him back either, Goat has to live forever in limbo. Buy Goat Simulator. Entertain Goat. Because this is all he has left.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4, 2014
												Let me be honest, i thought this game was going to be a joke. Ever since my gerbil's drug addiction, i have been searching for something to rebuild me and this is just it. The story is so deep and meaningful i found myself remembering moments from my childhood and reassessing past actions i have made like my arrest back in 98'. I started up this game and it ran butter smoothe and i could edit the options for optimal graphical settings. Okay enough bragging about my pc, lets get into the game. I was astonished at the transition from the menu to the game. It was as if the game spoke to me while it transformed from just another "game with a menu" to a PERFECT game with a menu. The grass moved with grace and the fences were plain brown. The first thing i did was jump over a stick so gracefully, a tear let out of my eye. After breaking the fence and blowing up a gas station i was inspired to go and sign up for an anger management course to stop beating my wife. Before this game it used to be me vs the world however, now the world and i work together to become one. I have simulated my goat life for around 3 or 4 hours but i am immersed. By not being able to die in this game, i have realized suicide is not the answer. If there were one word i would use to describe this game it would be inspirational. It has been so therapeutical being able to lick crowds of people and flying jetpacks at the same time. The community for this game is just astonishing. There is a whopping 15-20 mods on the workshop! thats more than even skyrim has. Some poeple may insult this game but they have obviously not experienced the work of art that IS Goat Simulator. The gameplay is better than fallout and far exceeds my very own expectations. It was so genius making "lick" E and "use" R. I mean, that is some real thinking right there. I can bring all the loose items near me into a ball AND lick them at the same time!!! i know this seems childish but i just love licking♥♥♥♥♥♥after discovering this game. Oh and the animation for licking is just perfect. Your tounge ACTUALLY BOUNCES!!! i know it sounds crazy but i swear this is real!! Also, the sounds are just what brings this work of art together. As i hear the hooves of the goat hit the ground i listen for the birds in the distance chirping and the hippies arguing to end♥♥♥♥♥♥♥shaped snacks. When i am doing something crazy like blowing up something, it sounds like i am just there. I can sort of feel the air coming from my screen and the flames and smoke look professional. It would be hard to explain but, thats why you're reading this getting your credit card ready to buy this masterpiece. If you do not like goat simulator, it' because you have not witnessed it first hand. When you actually have the mouse in your hand it is like a peaceful high. Your mind focuses on becoming a goat and your body adapts. At school, i find myself trying to "baaa" to impress my aqquaintances. Everyone supports my playing of this game and they often take pictures and videos of me performing my goat screams. People are claiming that there are bugs with this game but trust me, THERE ARE NO BUGS. THE GAME IS 150% PERFECT NO LIE. Currently i am sitting down listening to tupac and "baaaaing" the lyrics. I am so happy, i even told my parents that i found a love in life. She is this game but i havent told them yet. This game has changed my life so much and i have learned so much. Wether i am licking basketballs and blowing up cars with it or enjoying a peaceful game of flappy goat, i am always happy. This game is picture perfect and needs literally NO patches. If you buy it you will not regret this purchase. Definently my choice for Game Of The Year/Decade/Century/Milenium. If i had to rate this i would give it a 43/10 just because of it's inspiration on MY life and the many others who have played this. I love you all and please buy this game. $10 is a small price to pay for a great lifeley experience and i would definently pay $60 if i had to!!!

content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												Goat Simulator is a simulation game (so to speak) developed by Coffee Stain Studios. The main core of the experience is about controlling a common goat inside an urban area in an effort to achieve ... things.While the game has a score system, in truth your main objective is to discover new and creative way to use the goat you are given. You can headbutt people and objects, lick something and carry it around and so on. Some quests (so to speak) are pretty easy to clear, while others are far more obscure.As far as additional content goes, there are several goat statuettes that can be found around the map and goats models to unlock, each with a different gimmick and/or special power.In the end, the fun you are going to experience with Goat Simulator will be as long as your willingness to stick around trying to do everything that there is to do, which may take a good while

content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
												Why did I pick this one up?Well, the first (and main) reason is that I happen to like goats. They're cool. Goats are one of my favourite animals; they're certainly my favourite herbivorous mammal and just so happen to be my sign as well (Capricorn) so I've always considered them sort of my lucky animal-- in the same way as 34 is my lucky number. But that's neither here nor there.Aaaanyhow, about the actual game:It's a sandbox-style indie game, starring you as a very unrealistic goat. It should be fairly obvious by now that in no way is this an actual "goat simulator" that attempts to make you take on a realistic caprine role. It's very wacky and lighthearted and frivolous, and it's meant to be. And it even has a crazy story about a goat in purgatory, believe it or not. Check it out.As others have stated, Goat Simulator is fun in short bursts. I like sandbox games like this; such games give the player the freedom to run amok and do whatever your twisted little heart desires. The main goal is basically to cause as much destruction and mayhem as possible, and in the most creative ways possible. Try to cook up some wicked combos and you'll score high.If you dig sandboxy stuff, you'll probably enjoy this. If you like wrecking stuff and ramming innocent (and not-so-innocent) members of the homo sapiens species with your trusty set of horns, you'll definitely have a lot of fun with this game as well. It's not a game that's meant to be taken seriously, and I find it rather charming for what it is.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												He knew his mission well, but it would not be easy. Gingerly, the brave magician stepped up to the catapult. It was meant for sheep, yet he was a goat. The guard, too preoccupied with his thoughts to note the magician's valiant, yet foolhardy act, noticed all too late.A crack. A rush of air. The caprine hero sailed through the sky, over the walls of Twistram, crashing painfully to the ground behind the church.An uninformed onlooker may have thought him dead. Surely no beast could rise again after its limbs had been twisted so completely. Yet rise he did, determined to complete his mission. Composing himself, he skirted the churchyard, spotting a gathering by the far wall. Sombrely, he joined the mourners, who stood with bowed heads at the graveside.Boom! His fireball sent them soaring in all directions, some crumpling against the walls of the church, while others flew from the clifftop into the sea. His agile tongue quickly flung open the coffin, seizing the fish that lay within. The villagers were returning, but the walls of Twistram were too high. Swallowing the fish, he dove off the cliff. His only hope now was to follow the coast until he reached the home of the elves...A gripping tale of might, magic, majesty, and a gigantic wizard pig! Well that's Goat MMO Simulator anyway... I haven't pulled myself away for long enough to try the other modes yet.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												This game is best suited for a light hearted people that think creative or are easily entertained. This game was overhyped at start. It had a tiny map that could be completed 100% in 3 hours (and in which you could get bored in even less than that because of how limited it was). It was used as a youtube bait by some people. Hell, it was bad for its price tag. All of that, sure.  Now, it has a lot of new content. 2 new maps with a lot of quests to do, new unlockable playable characters, new abilities, tons of secrets and exploring. Is it fun now? Definitely! It's no longer limited to breaking stuff, ragdolling at people and breaking the game with glitches just like with any other sandbox game. For how long it will entertain me? Well, depends on how much content you are planning to unlock and what crazy ways you've come up with to complete the side quests. Most of the in-game jokes are overused memes and pop-culture references, but this game has its moments. Some of the personal expirience: Rode the bike as a t-rex. Rаped a man as a humping elf guy and then climbed the skyscraper by using the thrusting power of my body. Became a joust and slapped the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of people with my spear. Feeling lonely? content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
Goat Simulator ReviewAnother one of those goat simulator games.This game is the best goating simulation game of the year. I understand it's hard to get so much success on a big gaming trend like goat simulation but this goat simulator was by far the best. I licked a car into a fence. It exploded. The game mechanics are amazingly complex, this is next generation stuff right here. If you're a fan of hilarious comedy, then go away. This is a game to be taken deadly serious. It's all about the way of life and how to goat properly. Let's face it, we've all tried to goat at one point. Most of us fail, so this simulation game is perfect for those that are currently unable to goat correctly. This game teaches you the full goat etiquette, law and physics. I would recommend this game to anyone and everyone over the age of 22 and under the age of 23. I hope you learned something from this review. The game is certainly worthwhile, but if you laugh at it, then you're a sick person! This is a very serious game! Thanks for reading!

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												This game is far more enjoyable than the metacritic score would have you believe. If you're looking for actual structured goals, Goat Sim has a few, but overall very little to offer in that regard. There are trophies hidden throughout the maps, some in clever spots. There are secret areas and tasks, some of which unlock things (other characters, jetpacks etc) which give you more ways to tackle stuff.But ultimately this game is just a stupid,♥♥♥♥♥♥around, ragdoll/physics simulator. If you're okay with having your IQ damaged, give it a whirl. It'll give you a few hours of fun. I happen to like screwing around and accomplishing nothing in games, and this entire game accomplishes nothing. It's a blast.Being drunk helps.Oh, but beware: certain things, like the Demon/Jesus goat and the softball launcher (which spawn game assets) will gradually slow the game down. There is NO garbage collector. Objects do NOT despawn. If you pick up/become something that creates objects, the game will start to perform worse and worse as time goes on. So that Restart button comes in handy.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												Do you have any hopes, dreams, or plans for the future?  Is there perhaps a girl you like, or a hobby you want to pursue?  Are you concerned for the well-being of your fellow man?More importantly, do you want all these good desires to go away?If so, Goat Simulator is for you.An hour with Goat Simulator will strip away all your desires and replace them with a brain-dead level of sociopathy that can only be decribed as how a zombie feels after a few too many beers.For example, I just now finished Simulating a Goat.Before my session as Goat, I wanted to pursue a career.  I wanted to serve God.  I wanted to ask out this one girl.  I wanted to make a difference. I wanted to achieve.  I wanted to be...human.Now, I feel nothing.  No desires.  No wants.  No needs.  No anything.I know I am hungry, but I don't want food.  I am thirsty, but don't want drink.This is not Nirvana.  This is a living Hell.  And in this Hell, there is nothing but... Goat.But srsly, this game is good for a few hours of giggles if you don't mind losing your humanity.7/10, penalty for temporary loss of player's soul.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												He knew his mission well, but it would not be easy. Gingerly, the brave magician stepped up to the catapult. It was meant for sheep, yet he was a goat. The guard, too preoccupied with his thoughts to note the magician's valiant, yet foolhardy act, noticed all too late.A crack. A rush of air. The caprine hero sailed through the sky, over the walls of Twistram, crashing painfully to the ground behind the church.An uninformed onlooker may have thought him dead. Surely no beast could rise again after its limbs had been twisted so completely. Yet rise he did, determined to complete his mission. Composing himself, he skirted the churchyard, spotting a gathering by the far wall. Sombrely, he joined the mourners, who stood with bowed heads at the graveside.Boom! His fireball sent them soaring in all directions, some crumpling against the walls of the church, while others flew from the clifftop into the sea. His agile tongue quickly flung open the coffin, seizing the fish that lay within. The villagers were returning, but the walls of Twistram were too high. Swallowing the fish, he dove off the cliff. His only hope now was to follow the coast until he reached the home of the elves...A gripping tale of might, magic, majesty, and a gigantic wizard pig! Well that's Goat MMO Simulator anyway... I haven't pulled myself away for long enough to try the other modes yet.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
Goat Simulator ReviewAnother one of those goat simulator games.This game is the best goating simulation game of the year. I understand it's hard to get so much success on a big gaming trend like goat simulation but this goat simulator was by far the best. I licked a car into a fence. It exploded. The game mechanics are amazingly complex, this is next generation stuff right here. If you're a fan of hilarious comedy, then go away. This is a game to be taken deadly serious. It's all about the way of life and how to goat properly. Let's face it, we've all tried to goat at one point. Most of us fail, so this simulation game is perfect for those that are currently unable to goat correctly. This game teaches you the full goat etiquette, law and physics. I would recommend this game to anyone and everyone over the age of 22 and under the age of 23. I hope you learned something from this review. The game is certainly worthwhile, but if you laugh at it, then you're a sick person! This is a very serious game! Thanks for reading!

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												This game is far more enjoyable than the metacritic score would have you believe. If you're looking for actual structured goals, Goat Sim has a few, but overall very little to offer in that regard. There are trophies hidden throughout the maps, some in clever spots. There are secret areas and tasks, some of which unlock things (other characters, jetpacks etc) which give you more ways to tackle stuff.But ultimately this game is just a stupid,♥♥♥♥♥♥around, ragdoll/physics simulator. If you're okay with having your IQ damaged, give it a whirl. It'll give you a few hours of fun. I happen to like screwing around and accomplishing nothing in games, and this entire game accomplishes nothing. It's a blast.Being drunk helps.Oh, but beware: certain things, like the Demon/Jesus goat and the softball launcher (which spawn game assets) will gradually slow the game down. There is NO garbage collector. Objects do NOT despawn. If you pick up/become something that creates objects, the game will start to perform worse and worse as time goes on. So that Restart button comes in handy.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												Do you have any hopes, dreams, or plans for the future?  Is there perhaps a girl you like, or a hobby you want to pursue?  Are you concerned for the well-being of your fellow man?More importantly, do you want all these good desires to go away?If so, Goat Simulator is for you.An hour with Goat Simulator will strip away all your desires and replace them with a brain-dead level of sociopathy that can only be decribed as how a zombie feels after a few too many beers.For example, I just now finished Simulating a Goat.Before my session as Goat, I wanted to pursue a career.  I wanted to serve God.  I wanted to ask out this one girl.  I wanted to make a difference. I wanted to achieve.  I wanted to be...human.Now, I feel nothing.  No desires.  No wants.  No needs.  No anything.I know I am hungry, but I don't want food.  I am thirsty, but don't want drink.This is not Nirvana.  This is a living Hell.  And in this Hell, there is nothing but... Goat.But srsly, this game is good for a few hours of giggles if you don't mind losing your humanity.7/10, penalty for temporary loss of player's soul.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												~Tried playing it with a friend for 10 minutes before realizing it wasn't an actual MMO~To pass onto serious matters. Goat Simulator is one of those games you buy just to relax after a stressful day of work, or Dota, for example. I love this game because it help me chill out and prevents me from killing myself. It offers 2 Maps to explore, and with the expansion a third one is added. You have collectables scattered across them and lots of cool Easter Eggs as well. Many bugs in this game, but most of them are just funny, rather than gamebreaking.The MMO expansion was added for FREE! (epic move) It will literally make you feel as if you're really playing it with other people... until you realize it is a simulation as well. Some skills and controls could've been made better as it's rather annoying to press 1 and E to take stuff but you can handle it. Collectibles and easter eggs in this one as well.>I'd give it a 9/10>Pros: Fun, sandbox, collectibles, cards, achievements, easter eggs and references, free expansion and updates(or so it is at the time I'm writing this), glitchy goodness>Cons: Some bugs require you to restart the map(collecting money which goes through floor etc), might get annoying to have to look for the remainder of the rare collectibles, it's not for everyone, perhaps the price tag is a tad bit high.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Outnumbered and outgunned, but not outgoated.Goat® Simulator™, developed by Coffee Stain Studios (developers of Sanctum™), harnesses the first three-year, all next-gen development cycle in goat simulation history. Goat® Simulator™ envisions a powerful future, where both technology and tactic have evolved to usher in a new era of goat fidelity for the franchise. Delivering a stunning performance, Academy Award® winning actor Kevin Spacey stars as Jonathan Irons - one of the most powerful goatmen in the world - shaping this chilling vision of the future of goat.Goat® Simulator™ is an extraordinary step forward for one of the largest entertainment franchises of all-time. This new chapter in the Goat® Simulator™ franchise features a new dynamic where players are on the side of a crippled goat fighting not for freedom, or liberty, but simply to survive.Fueling this all new Goat® simulation experience, the franchise's new next-gen engine delivers stunning levels of immersion and performance, all while maintaining the speed and fluidity of 60 frames-per-second across all platforms.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
												NOTE: I have only played this game for 6 hours at the time of writing. My opinion about the game may or may not change by the time I play more of this game.Rate: 8.9/10I absolutely love this game. It is hilarious; you are a goat, you have a city to go around in and you can be different versions of goats, Perfect. The content in this game is pretty hard to run out of, a lotta things you can do. The good: I love the developers (I ♥♥♥♥ING LOVE SANCTUM 2, havent played the first one though) for working  so hard on the tiny little details, overall it can be a game changer (get it?).  Say, for example, the fireworks (Great addition by the way). Normally, a person won't pay too much attention to these things, but after a few hours of playing the game, you start to realize how well-developed the game really is. This is one of the things amongst many others (flappy goat, trampolines, for more examples). I like the way you can ride bicycles, interact with humans, become the goat lord (yes, you can summon peasant #PCMR), become a devil goat, slides are cool,  MINEGOAT, apparently ride stakeboards, mod the game, JETPACKS, become a super strong goat, explode cars, COMPLETELY defy the laws of gravity and tons of other things. The graphics are 9.1, by no means perfect.NEED TO MAKE A NEW PARAGRAPH FOR THIS: slow-mo. ♥♥♥♥IN AWESOMEThe bad: I cant really comment much on the topic of glitches, they are part of the fun this game has. What I can do is rant about the people in the game randomly going on top of fences among other stuff they randomly climb on top of. WHY COFFE STUDIOS, WHY?. I know it makes it funny sometimes but still, it annoys the crap out of me sometimes. *just playing flappy goat* WOOPS A GUY ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ TELEPORTS IN FRONT OF ME. Sanctum 2 didnt have any glitches, it was perfect like silver. Its a comepletely different game but damnnnnnnnnnnnnn it's annoying to have a guy come on your face. Another complaint: Maybe I am just a n00b or is it that some of the achievements are damn hard? No more to that complaint, just a bit hard. Another small complaint which is completely based off my opinion: There needs to be more references. I love the minecraft and sanctum 2 references (and a bunch of other changed-the-logo-so-I-dont-get-sued references), but it needs more.CONCLUSION: Buy this game if you are a bit into open world games, love trying to get achievements, love screaming, love goats and love funny/fun games.PS: Totally worth it, even though I was gifted a copyPSS: You are a goat

content:
Posted: April 2, 2014
												It's like an old school Tony Hawk game but instead of Tony Hawk and skateboarding we play as a goat. You are free to fulfill any of your goat needs in this game. You can be a space goat and travel to outer space or you can be a acrobatic goat and do flips on a trampoline. You are free to do what ever you want and only your imagination stops you. The game includes an development kit so you can do your own maps and mods. It's welll worth the 9.99€ and has hours of fun and creativity. I strongly recommend this game for people that like sandbox game's like Garry's Mod. I think this game will pass on generation after generation and people are going to have epic goat stories.  tl;drYou can do whatever you want that is goat related and only your imagination is stopping you.This game gets an strong 9/10 and it will be played generation after generation.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
												I don't know if I "Get" this game.  I've run around, I've blown up people, I've destroyed cars, I've let people ride me.  I'm a goat, hear me bleat!While Goat Simulator is a nice relatively simple game, it's just that, an overall relatively simple game.  It's not like a lot of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ "simulators" that try to cash in on Goat Simulator's success.  It's also not like the really well thought out simulators, like Bus Simulator or such. It's hard to really describe Goat simulator.  You're a goat, you run around and do anything you want.  You have bad animation, but you rarely look at the goat itself.  There's even a skate board ramp at one point, only thing is you don't "Skate" you just ragdoll your body and throw it around, and yet it works.  I don't know if I'd heavily recommend this game, because it feels unpolished at almost any angle, the animation of the goat is weak, and the "game" is... well I don't know if there's really a game. But it's still wicked fun to go run around the level and act like an animal.If you have a couple guys over and want to just have a blast, the local co-op actually works quite well.   Definitely good for a half hour of so of just laughter seeing what you can do.

												Have you ever wanted to know what it would be like to be a goat?  Well this game perfectly simulates what a goat does in real life.  It even has realistic npc's that react to everything you do.  This by no means is a game that is meant for laughter.  It is to show what being a goat is like...well if they ruled the world.  Oh yeah, there is no A.I., everything just ragdolls when you ram it or even whack it with the car you held on to your goat/tall goat/feather goat/<insert name here> goat tongue.  10/10 would play again.
